title: Session Cookie Without Secure Flag

profile.name: Ed
profile.about: This is a vulnerability disclosure program for all of my personal projects and code that I publish.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Ed,

The bug mentioned in the report #343095 is not yet correctly patched I believe.

Previously, the Researcher reports that the cookie(_gitlab_session) is not Secure (Missing Secure Flag) and u closed that report as Informative and said that 
"Expoitability of this issue is so low that it does not warrant an immediate fix. 
In order to actually exploit this issue you would need to find an XSS vulnerability. 
Please feel free to prove me wrong by hacking me."

U said:
In order to actually exploit this issue you would need to find an XSS vulnerability. 

But Let me tell u that it doesn't require XSS to exploit. Insecure HTTPOnly cookies require XSS.
It requires MITM(Man-In-The-Middle) Attack to steal that cookie.

I submit this report only for your comment "Please feel free to prove me wrong by hacking me."

Thanks
Cheers
Anas

## Impact

Attacker may steal session cookie through MITM.

activities.message:
Thanks for the report! Unfortunately, your submission is out of scope as outlined in the security policy.

Your effort is nonetheless appreciated, and we wish that you'll continue to research and submit any future security issues you find.

Kind Regards.

activities.message:
If the cookie is missing Secure Flag then it doesn't require XSS, it requires MITM.
Cookie missing HttpOnly flag require XSS.
So plz pass this report to Ed

activities.message:
Tomayto, tomahto — I got things a little mixed up in the previous report. My policy makes it explicitly clear that I am not interested in these type of reports. Hardenize easily detects these issues and as you probably noticed that is a GitLab instance, I do not have much control over how that actual application works. I am really looking for mistakes that I made while setting up and using that platform.

\- Ed
activities.markdown_message:

I am really looking for mistakes that I made while setting up and using that platform.

- Ed

activities.message: Disclosing this report in the hopes that nobody will report this type of issue again.
activities.markdown_message: Disclosing this report in the hopes that nobody will report this type of issue again.

activities.message:
Hello @edoverflow ,
You updated the severity of this issue from Medium to None and I agree that the severity is none.
It's not a report about cookie missing flag.
Perviously u close the researcher report (Cookie Missing Secure Flag) as Informative and said that 'In order to actually exploit this issue you would need to find an XSS vulnerability'.
But it doesn't require XSS.
If the cookie is missing Secure Flag then it doesn't require XSS, it requires MITM.
Cookie missing HttpOnly flag require XSS.
So, I just made this report to correct your comment.
Also, You said
Please feel free to prove me wrong by hacking me
So,
I think that u should re-open  this report and close this as Informative.

activities.message:
In future, @cybertiger, please contact me via a separate channel — several are listed in my policy — if you are not sure about my decision in a previously-disclosed report. This would ensure that I don't have to close your report as N/A and allows us to discuss it properly without anybody getting frustrated.

\- Ed

\- Ed

summaries.content:
Hello Everyone,
It's not a report.
In a comment, Ed @edoverflow said that the cookie Missing 'Secure' Flag requires XSS.
But I think that the cookie missing Secure Flag doesn't require XSS. It requires MITM(Man-In-The-Middle).
Cookie missing 'HttpOnly'Flag requires XSS.
If u think that I'm correct so plz vote up this report.
Thanks.
summaries.content_html:
Hello Everyone,
It's not a report.
In a comment, Ed @edoverflow said that the cookie Missing 'Secure' Flag requires XSS.
But I think that the cookie missing Secure Flag doesn't require XSS. It requires MITM(Man-In-The-Middle).
Cookie missing 'HttpOnly'Flag requires XSS.
If u think that I'm correct so plz vote up this report.
Thanks.
